content: I think I'll suggest "The Skin You Live In" by Michael Tyler for the next reading event. It's a great way to promote diversity and self-acceptance among kids. By the way, I've also been involved in an online beta reading group for a debut author, Rachel Lee, who is set to release her novel in April. It's been interesting to see the revisions and changes over time. Do you have any advice on how to provide constructive feedback as a beta reader?
